in most organizations there's a huge amount of white space of just things that have not been tried because they're

the things in a conventional lens if all we have is a hammer everything looks like a nail

easily and securely oh hopefully you'd say that's interesting Simon please tell me more so
the short answer is you can you can do this by connecting your existing data
center into the AWS Cloud using a technology called virtual private cloud
you can also choose the manner and style of connectivity between your existing
data center or data centers and your virtual private cloud or virtual private clouds I'll talk a bit

different modes of why and how you would do this now this is not the exhaustive list but this is a fairly representative
list of the kinds of things we see customers trying to do we see customers who have the island the isolated project
we see customers who are sort of living in the bubble and just want to expand the internal sites out a little bit more
have a bit more space we see customers who want to present themselves to the world but use infrastructure and
resource not of their own and we of course have the much unloved branch office environment as well which all of
us struggle with so let's look at those a little bit of detail the oscillator project is a great one
this is a great example of stuff you need to do quickly that may have an interesting chance of success or failure
it may be a transient thing we're doing something for compliance purposes or someone got an idea they want to try some new software we need an environment
to play in now this is often hard to get and often I talk to customers I say look
we just need a Windows lab we need 30 machines that's all I need I say great I'll show you in 10 minutes how you do

a customer once who built an entire iPad application full high bandwidth back end
mongodb up the Wazoo they had built this beautiful thing but they weren't sure if they were going to release it
so I spent six months building this application big development team built the whole thing intentionally saying if
we're not happy with this product we will not release it and it was okay because when they decided not to release
it they turned off all the infrastructure that they are running in their virtual private cloud and walked away
and they couldn't do that conventionally so it gave them a lot of options in terms of that fast fowl project but this
is useful where you don't need to talk back to anything existing you're just doing your own thing you're in your own world
more often than not you want to expand an existing system into the cloud either part of that system or all of that
system so in this particular model we can do that we can extend using our virtual
private Network into our virtual private cloud we can choose not to expose any of our
resources that are running in the Amazon virtual private Cloud to the internet
traffic can only Traverse my virtual private Network back into my own network and that's the only way it can be
accessed so this is really useful for doing Dev tests you know I do Dev tests maybe once every three months I need to
do a whole test run I need to scale up I want to do something that I want to go away really simple or maybe I want to do
some Disaster Recovery or maybe I want to move entire corporate systems across into this environment I have a customer
who moved all their SharePoint or their content management system or their internal HR systems to the cloud because
they just didn't want to manage the on-premise infrastructure anymore they didn't want to put on the internet they just wanted to have it in their own
virtual private Cloud so this is a very effective model for that type of work the benefit here as well is you can use
existing management tools so if you're using different patch rollout mechanisms or monitoring tools Etc the rules are
the same and I'll show you how that works shortly then you can choose to present the
resources that you have in your virtual private Cloud out to a broader community so this is a really useful pattern when
you've got internal systems maybe it's order Management systems or inventory systems or other type of order taking
systems but you want your web front-end maybe your marketing campaign to be really elastic
so you can have that public facing component visible to the internet visible to users
visible to Partners but the communications from that tier back is all done privately and is done
to your existing resource so this is a very Blended and effective approach
because we know you're not going to say and just lift everything you've got and move it in one Fell Swoop you're going to have a combination of things over
time this allows for that and then as I mentioned we have a much
loved branch office scenario often the problem child for it because there's never enough money or resources often
low bandwidth between those sites you can interconnect multiple sites into a virtual private Cloud they can share the
resource they can even enter Network between sites seamlessly
so this allows you to give Branch officers access to way more compute and storage than they would have had
previously it's really useful for collaboration between geographically dispersed teams
one of the trends I'm seeing is a situation where software development in Australia is being done both onshore and
offshore so a team in Melbourne a team in China a team in Sydney a team in Philippines for
example they can all collaborate and use the same infrastructure so how do we make this connection how do
we put all of this together so we use this thing called the virtual private cloud
and put simply the virtual private Cloud lets you create your own private IP address space on top of Amazon web
services you get to choose whether you want private addressing public addressing a
combination of the two you choose how data is ingressed or egressed from the environment you set
all those rules and the nice thing is is that with the concepts and ideas encapsulated in
Virtual private Cloud are very familiar to people who are very opaque with traditional networking Technologies
subnets Access Control lists virtual private Network order offer Ducks back
for a networking person they all exist here so how does this look how do we put this
together so if we think about our existing environment our existing Data Center
we can choose a region for the sake of argument let's choose our Sydney how's that yeah finally I can
say let's choose Sydney and in our Sydney region we can create a
virtual private Cloud across multiple availability zones you've heard us talk about these availability zones use them
always deploy across multiple availability zones your virtual private Cloud spans availability zones and has virtual
routing that allows you to set the rules that you want in terms of where traffic goes you have total control over this
you can then connect back into your on-premise environment using a virtual private Network into a router device
this is a hardware device or it can be a software device can even be a Windows 2008 R2 server if you want it to be
the nice thing is it can use border Gateway protocol or static routing which is a new innovation that happened just a
couple of months ago which essentially means more devices support this methodology
what we then do is create different subnets within our virtual private Cloud they can be private which means I can
only Route traffic internally in my internal Network or public which means I can rat traffic out to the internet
I then create my instances within those subnets like I normally would and I can obviously have an internet
gateway that allows traffic to egress out to the internet if I so choose for those subnets that I determine are
allowed to do so in addition I can connect multiple Branch offices into this environment if
I want to I can also access all my other resources as well so all the familiar services
within Amazon are accessible to you and I can also use this thing called Direct Connect and I'll talk about this
in more detail shortly but think of it as a dedicated line between your site
and Amazon so what do I get for my virtual private
Cloud well firstly each virtual private Cloud gives you a user-defined address space of over 65 000 addresses
so if you're going to run out of addresses I really want to talk to you because I'd love to talk about that but
essentially what this means is that you get to set your own IP address range which means it is compatible with your
internal naming standards and your internal Network management these are your addresses their private
addresses which also means that by default non-routable to the internet you can create multiple subnets 20 is
just the base limit you can have way more than that but again you can choose how big they are depending on the use case and what you're trying to achieve
with them you get to Define your routing your DHCP servers you get to Define Access Control
lists Etc and I'll show you some of that shortly the IP address is that your instances
get when you create an instance are stable once they're assigned what does that mean this means that when you stop
and restart an instance it retains the same IP address throughout the lifetime and life cycle of the instance this is
really useful for management tools that aren't Cloud friendly that aren't used to instances coming and going and
changing addresses all the time that doesn't happen in Virtual private Cloud if your server comes up as 10.1.2.3 and
you stop it and you start it again it will be 10.1.2.3 all the time which is really handy
we also support these funky things called elastic network interfaces or Enis and this allows you to separate the
life cycle of the network interface of an instance from the instance itself
so something we've broken apart these two components and they can live independent of one another and I'll
share with you some ideas of what you can do with that shortly so again what this world means is that
when you're launching your instances into the environment instead of launching into a kind of flat environment here where you're kind of
sharing the address space with other customers we're launching our own instances
and when those instances come up they come up with just the addresses that I set within my virtual private cloud
and they're all internal addresses so I control what happens at the networking layer
now I have access to a lot of Rich things in Virtual private Cloud so obviously I've got ec2 the elastic
compute cloud and I've got EBS the elastic Block store for compute and storage but I have my load balancer not
only do I have my public facing load balancer I have an internal load balancer service I can use as well so I
can have load balancing between my customers and my web tier and then I can have a load balancer between my web T
and my app tier kind of Handy kind of helps you build for failure I can also do auto scaling I can do
Cloud watch like we saw Daniel do just before so all these Technologies are available to you I can launch my
relational database service so I can have a managed MySQL Oracle or SQL Server database running within the
confines of myvpc I can also do cool things like spin up elastic map produce which is essentially
a hosted Hadoop service that allows you to do massive amounts of big data processing without having to buy an
infrastructure it's a very powerful service encapsulated again in this environment so you control the naming
you control the traffic we can do other things like cloud formation which I'll show you shortly
cluster compute instances in regions where it's supported and lots of others
so we talked about connecting a little bit I want to expand upon that so the primary way that people connect to their
virtual private cloud is using a VPN a virtual private Network this is an encrypted ipsec tunnel between your site
and our site now I didn't mention before but the cost of a VPC is zero it's personally my
favorite cost I like it when our customers don't have to pay anything for anything but to set up a VPC cost you nothing
obviously the resources you run within the VPC incura cost and if you choose to
have a VPN connection a hardware VPN connection you'll pay five cents an hour basically 36 dollars a month
that's kind of change if you think about it and as I mentioned we support both bgp and no bgp which means that in all
likelihood the routers you already have in your environment would support this method of connectivity
you set it up yourself you set up via the console when you jump into the console you choose the type of routing
router you've got how you want to connect it gives you the credentials your network person load that into the router and you're good to go it's a very
straightforward configuration process does not require human beings which is really important to get things done very quickly
also just out of interest when you connect a connection to us we actually run two tunnels
to two different Hardware devices this means that you're able to have
failover between those devices if we're doing maintenance and other things
so I mentioned before Direct Connect what is direct connect Direct Connect allows you have dedicated bandwidth
between your site and AWS so if you don't want that internet thing don't have anything to do with it that's
no problem you can choose to have increments of one gig 10 gig and have those connections running between your
site and outs now this is useful in cases where you have a requirement for really low
latency or a controlled latency experience because you have that service committed to you or you want really high
amounts of bandwidth so if you're moving large amounts of data to internal systems this becomes a really compelling
option doesn't matter which carrier you're with you can work with any carrier you like
go talk to the guys at the equinix stand they'll talk to you about exactly how to get this set up because we work through
Partners to make this happen use VLAN tagging to manage the connections between the sites so if you want to have
a connection that hosts some of the public information to maybe S3 you can do that as well as having connectivity
over your VPN so you have a lot of richness and a lot of choice in how you deploy this you don't have to use direct
